Meeting Title: Attorney General's Foreclosure Mediation Workgroup Meeting
Short Description: The Attorney GeneralÛªs Foreclosure Mediation Workgroup is charged with developing guidelines for the foreclosure mediation program established under SB 1552
Meeting Location: Justice Building, Kulongoski Room, 1162 Court Street NE
Details: The Attorney General convened a 16-member Attorney General’s Foreclosure Mediation Workgroup to aid in the development of rules for administering the Foreclosure Mediation Program established under Senate Bill 1552 (2012). The April 13 meeting will include updates on the program budget and impending E-Board request and reports by workgroup subcommittees.

Meeting Title: Task Force on Profiling by Law Enforcement
Meeting Location: RCC/SOU Higher Education Center, 101 S. Bartlett, Room 129B
Details:
Attorney General Ellen Rosenblum will give a summary of the work of the Task Force followed by brief statements from attendees. She wants to hear from the community about how police profiling affects you and any suggestions you may have for the Task Force to consider. You may bring or send in written testimony instead of, or in addition to, your oral statement.  Please try to keep statements to no longer than five minutes. Thank you. 
 
Contact Sandi Lopez, sandi.lopez@doj.state.or.us or (503) 378-6002.  You may send your statement via email or U.S. mail to Department of Justice, Office of the Attorney General, re: Profiling Task Force; 1162 Court St NE, Salem, OR 97301.
 
The meeting location is accessible to persons with disabilities.  Please make requests for any special needs at least 48 hours in advance. Thank you.

Meeting Title: Attorney General's Public Records Law Reform Task Force
Meeting Location: 155 Cottage Street NE, Conference Room B
Details:
Members of the Attorney General’s Public Records Law Reform Task Force will be accepting public comments on the Oregon Public Records Law, and the work of the task force, on Wednesday, January 13, from 4:00 to 6:00 PM. Please join us next door to the Oregon State Capitol to share your experiences, suggestions, or other thoughts with task force members.

​Location:
Department of Administrative Services Executive Building
155 Cottage Street NE 
Salem, OR 97301

All are welcome to attend.

Information about the work of the task force is available on the Public Records Law Reform Task Force website. Currently, that work is focused primarily on the hundreds of disclosure exemptions that keep information out of public hands – and can make the law difficult to implement. Other issues that the task force expects to examine include the cost and timeliness of public records disclosures. The task force wants to hear from Oregonians on these and other public records law subjects.

Questions about this announcement, and requests for accommodations by individuals with disabilities, can be directed to Michael Kron, Michael.C.Kron@doj.state.or.us.

Meeting Title: Task Force on Law Enforcement Profiling
Meeting Location: U of O School of Journalism - Allen Hall, Room 141
Details:
Attorney General Ellen Rosenblum and other participants on the State Task Force on Law Enforcement Profiling will give a summary of the work of the Task Force and will conduct a discussion in a Q & A format regarding profiling by police and how the legislature should continue to address this issue in 2017.

If you are not able to attend, but have questions or comments for the Task Force please send them via email or U.S. mail to Department of Justice, Office of the Attorney General, re: Profiling Task Force; 1162 Court St NE, Salem, OR 97301.

An interactive campus map can be accessed at http://admissions.uoregon.edu/visit/maps  Please use this to find your way around campus.   U of O is a campus so street addresses are for reference only.  Please reference the campus maps.  

MEETING will be held in Allan Hall:  street address is 1275 University Street.  The closest intersection is University and 13th Avenue.  Allen Hall is about 1.5 blocks west of the Matt Knight Arena, which can be used for parking.  

PARKING:  Visitors can park for free at the Matt Knight Arena parking garage, which is accessed via 1390 Villard Street.  Driving directions to the parking arena can be accessed at http://matthewknightarena.com/directions.php

Parking stub can be validated at the Ford Alumni Center located at 1720 East 13th Street (next to the Matt Knight Arena parking garage).

If you need additional information please contact Joan at 503.378.6002.

Meeting Title: Oregon Sunshine Committee 2018
Details:
The Oregon Sunshine Committee will hold its second meeting on Wednesday, March 21 at 1:00 PM. The meeting will be held at the Oregon State Capitol (900 Court St NE, Salem, OR 97301) in Hearing Room 343. The meeting will also be streamed live on the Citizen Engagement Legislative Video website.
Agenda
•	Choosing a vice chair; vice chair duties. (Discussion, probable vote.)
•	Organizing review of exemptions. (Discussion, probable vote.)
•	Where, specifically, to begin with exemption review. (Possible discussion, possible vote.)
•	Content of report due July 1, 2018. (Discussion, possible vote.)
•	Communicating with stakeholders and the public. (Discussion, possible vote.)
•	Approval of prior meeting’s minutes. (Possible discussion, vote.)

Questions about this notice, including questions about accommodations for individuals with disabilities, can be directed to Michael Kron (michael.c.kron@doj.state.or.us).

Meeting Title: Oregon Sunshine Committee 2018
Details:
The Oregon Sunshine Committee will hold its first meeting on Wednesday, January 31 at 1:00 PM. The meeting will be held at the Oregon State Capitol (900 Court St NE, Salem, OR 97301) in Hearing Room D. The meeting will also be streamed live on the legislative website.

Agenda
Welcome by Attorney General Rosenblum
Member self-introductions
Discussion: function of Sunshine Committee
Discussion: organizing and scheduling review of exemptions
Discussion: future meeting dates

Useful background information
HB 2101, which created the Oregon Sunshine Committee and describes its duties, can be found here.
A beta version of the electronic catalogue of public records exemptions can be found here.
